context_meta.title: Republican senator asks Trump if he's 'recanting oath' over war with press
context_meta.summary: Donald Trump's ongoing war with the media over "fake news" escalated on Wednesday with the president calling for networks, and specifically NBC, to have their licenses revoked over reporting what he called "pure fiction." And one Republican senator inserted himself in the middle of the fight Wednesday evening. The White House and Defense Secretary Jim Mattis denied the report. Trump's threat to pull NBC's license drew Sen. Ben Sasse, R-Neb., into the fight.

context_meta.summary: Donald Trump's ongoing war with the media over "fake news" escalated on Wednesday with the president calling for networks, and specifically NBC, to have their licenses revoked over reporting what he called "pure fiction." And one Republican senator inserted himself in the middle of the fight Wednesday evening. The White House and Defense Secretary Jim Mattis denied the report. Trump's threat to pull NBC's license drew Sen. Ben Sasse, R-Neb., into the fight.

text: Okay M&M. I choose Donald Trump. He's our president and you're a no-talent hack trying to cater to an angry, liberal, black audience in an effort to revive your dwindling career.

context_meta.summary: Rapper Eminem aimed a devastating blow at President Trump during the BET Hip Hop Awards on Tuesday night.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: The excruciating uncertainty of the California wildfires
context_meta.summary: Perhaps the only thing that’s certain for the roughly 175,000 residents of this California wine-growing region being terrorized by devastating wildfires is that no one knows what’s going to happen next.

text: Do these homeowners and renters have insurance that will pay for their homes and belongings?

text: Man, I hate all of the political garbage on here. I do have to admit that I am torn emotionally. The governor of California gives the President the finger by declaring his state a "sanctuary state" and refusing to follow Federal Law, yet some of the people affected by the fires voted against him, does my compassion for innocent victims overcome my disdain for Gov. Brown and his followers arrogance? Especially since now Brown is asking for Federal Funds? Opinions???

text: California is not a liberal state. It's half conservative, and it frequently proves it. A few years ago, it voted against gay marriage and legalizing weed. A number of governors have been conservative, including the last one, and, of course, the conservative patron saint, Ronald Regan. So all you conservatives constantly hating on California don't know what you're talking about and are spewing pointless hate, not because you have something to say, but because you have dark, corrupted hearts and horrible attitudes. Grow up.

text: While Californians are suffering total loss of their homes and some dying in California wildfires our Governor is signing legislation on the correct gender pronouns for transsexuals. Something is seriously wrong with Democrats in this state.

text: Between fire and water, this Country is seeing so much devastation.  Hurricane Harvey in Texas, Irma in Florida and the south, Maria in Puerto Rico (a US territory), and now the wild fires in California.  All this will cost a fortune to rebuild.  No time for our government to be wasting $26 billion on building a wall between us and Mexico when there are far more urgent needs.
